sen.j: 継室（けいしつ）は、後妻のこと。
正室と同じく、日本の歴史において身分の高い者が継室となる場合が多い。
sen.e: In the history of Japan, there were many cases in which a woman of high standing became a keishitsu, as in the case of lawful wife.
In the history of Japan, there were many cases in which a woman of high standing became a keishitsu, as in the case of a lawful wife.
In the history of Japan, there were many cases in which a woman of high standing became a keishitsu, as in the case of a lawful wife.

sen.j: 一般的に誤解されていることとして、寵愛深かった側室が正室の死後（もしくは離婚後）継室として格上げされるというものがある。
sen.e: It is a popular misconception that the most favorite concubine was raised to the position of the keishitsu after the death (or the divorce) of the lawful wife.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It is a popular misconception that the most favorite concubine was raised to the position of the keishitsu after the death (or the divorce) of the lawful wife.
It is a popular misconception that the most favorite concubine was raised to the position of the keishitsu after the death (or the divorce) of the lawful wife.

sen.j: これは、日本の奥のありようから考えても可能性が低いものである。
sen.e: This was very unlikely to happen considering the condition of ordinary wife of a nobleman in Japan.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: This was very unlikely to happen considering the condition of an ordinary wife of a nobleman in Japan.
This was very unlikely to happen considering the condition of an ordinary wife of a nobleman in Japan.
